title: TN weather Reoprt: சென்னையில் கொட்டிய கனமழை, இன்றைய நிலவரம் என்ன? எந்தெந்த மாவட்டங்களுக்கு ரெட் அலெர்ட் - வானிலை அறிக்கை - ABP News
article_text:
TN weather Reoprt: தமிழ்நாட்டின் சில மாவட்டங்களில் அடுத்த சில தினங்களுக்கு, கனமழைக்கான சூழல் நிலவுவதாக வானிலை மையம் எச்சரித்துள்ளது.
தென்னிந்திய பகுதிகளின் மேல் ஒரு வளிமண்டல மேலடுக்கி சுழற்சி நிலவுவதாலும்,  மேற்கு திசை காற்றின் வேக மாறுபாடு காரணமாகவும் அடுத்த சில தினங்களுக்கு தமிழ்நாட்டில் பரவலாக மழை பொழிய வாய்ப்புள்ளதாக மண்டல வானிலை மையம் எச்சரித்து உள்ளது. அதன்படி, சென்னையின் பல்வேறு பகுதிகளில் நள்ளிரவில் பரவலான மழை பதிவானது. கோடம்பாக்காம், பெரியார்பாதை, சூளைமேடு, நுங்கம்பாக்கம், கோயம்பேடு, அரும்பாக்கம், ஆயிரம் விளக்கு உள்ளிட்ட பகுதிகளில் மழை பதிவானது. இதனால் பகலில் சுட்டெரித்த வெயிலின் தாக்கம் குறைந்து, குளிச்ச்சியான சூழல் நிலவுகிறது.
தமிழகத்தில் இன்று ஒருசில இடங்களிலும், புதுவை மற்றும் காரைக்கால் பகுதிகளிலும் இடி, மின்னலுடன் கூடிய லேசானது முதல் மிதமான மழை பெய்யக்கூடும். ஓரிரு இடங்களில் பலத்த தரைக்காற்று மணிக்கு 40 முதல் 50 கிலோ மீட்டர் வேகத்தில் வீசக்கூடும். நீலகிரி மாவட்டம் மற்றும் கோயம்புத்தூர் மாவட்டத்தின் மலைப்பகுதிகளில் ஓரிரு இடங்களில் கன முதல் மிக கனமழையும், தேனி, தென்காசி, செங்கல்பட்டு, திருவள்ளூர், சென்னை, ராணிபேட்டை, காஞ்சீபுரம், வேலூர், விழுப்புரம், மற்றும் திருவண்ணாமலை மாவட்டங்களில் ஓரிரு இடங்களில் கனமழை பெய்ய வாய்ப்புள்ளது.
சென்னையை பொறுத்தவரையில் வானம் ஓரளவு மேகமூட்டத்துடன் காணப்படும். நகரின் ஒருசில பகுதிகளில் இடி, மின்னலுடன் கூடிய மிதமான - கன மழை பெய்ய வாய்ப்புள்ளது. அதிகபட்ச வெப்பநிலை 35-36° செல்சியஸை ஒட்டியும், குறைந்தபட்ச வெப்பநிலை 26-27° செல்சியஸை ஒட்டியும் இருக்கக்கூடும்.
வானிலை மையம் வெளியிட்டுள்ள அறிக்கையின்படி,

22-07-2025: தமிழகத்தில் ஒருசில இடங்களிலும், புதுவை மற்றும் காரைக்கால் பகுதிகளிலும் இடி, மின்னலுடன் கூடிய, லேசானது முதல் மிதமான மழை பெய்யக்கூடும். நீலகிரி மற்றும் கோயம்புத்தூர் மாவட்டத்தின் மலை பகுதிகளில் ஓரிரு இடங்களில் கனமழையும் பெய்ய வாய்ப்புள்ளது.

title: Chennai Weather Update: Heavy Rain To Hit These Regions Of Tamil Nadu; Check Details - MSN
article_text:
Chennai: The capital city is known as the Gateway to South India, and usually experiences hot and humid weather conditions during the summer and early monsoon months. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted a mix of rain and scorching heat across Tamil Nadu over the next few days.
The city's weather is expected to remain warm and humid, with occasional chances of light rainfall due to the ongoing Southwest Monsoon influence. On Thursday, the capital city woke up at 05: 50 AM and the sun is likely to set at 6: 39 PM. Today, the minimum and maximum temperatures are likely to be around 29 degrees Celsius and 35 degrees Celsius, respectively. The humidity is expected to be around 73 per cent.
The IMD has predicted rainfall to continue over Tamil Nadu. Other parts of the state will experience light rainfall, and it is likely to be accompanied by thunderstorms. The temperatures are expected to remain above normal, causing discomfort in several regions.
The city may experience gusty winds. Chennai is likely to experience light to moderate rainfall. Meanwhile, rainfall is also predicted in districts, including Western Ghats, Puducherry, Karaikal, Nilgiris, Tenkasi, Coimbatore, Tirunelveli, Theni, Kancheepuram, Chengalpattu, and Perambalur until the weekend. The skies are expected to be cloudy, and it will remain the same throughout the day.
Bengaluru Weather Forecast: Heavy Rain To Lash City This Week; Check More Details
If you're planning to go outdoors, it's advisable to stay hydrated and wear light, breathable clothing. Keeping an umbrella handy could help in case of sudden rain spells. It's also a good idea to avoid outdoor activities during peak afternoon hours when the heat and humidity are at their highest.
SS Rajamouli’s blockbuster Baahubali completed 10 years since its release. The film that blurred regional barriers in Indian cinema also made Prabhas a global phenomenon. The cast and crew of Baahubali reunited to celebrate the film’s anniversary today (July 10). Rajamouli, Prabhas, Rana Daggubati, Sathyaraj and others met in Hyderabad. M. M. Keeravani, who lost his father recently, was also seen at the reunion.
The official social media handle for Baahubali shared pictures from the anniversary reunion. The caption read, “What began as a dream turned into something far bigger than any of us could have imagined. A story that became a part of people’s lives… A journey that brought us together as one family… And memories we will cherish forever. As we come together to celebrate 10 years of Baahubali, we are filled with deep gratitude — for every single person who believed in this story, stood by us, and helped make it what it is today. This reunion was more than nostalgic — it brought back a flood of memories from over a decade. We fondly reminisced about everything that went right… and all the things that could have gone wrong, but didn’t. It’s those very moments that ensured Baahubali became what it is today. But this celebration isn’t just ours. It belongs to every one of you who carries Baahubali in your hearts. Here’s to the memories, the magic, and the epic that lives on… Quoting Paulo Coelho from The Alchemist: “When you want something, all the universe conspires in helping you to achieve it.”
ALSO READ: Baahubali Clocks 10 Years! SS Rajamouli Announces Re-Release, Prabhas' Epic Set To Return On...
On Baahubali’s 10 anniversary, Rajamouli announced the franchise’s re-release. He tweeted, “Baahubali… The beginning of many journeys. Countless memories. Endless inspiration. It’s been 10 years. Marking this special milestone with #BaahubaliTheEpic, a two-part combined film. In theatres worldwide on October 31, 2025.”
Baahubali also featured Anushka Shetty, Tamannaah Bhatia, Ramya Krishnan, and Nassar in important roles.

title: Tamil Nadu Weather: IMD Issues Rain, Thunderstorm Alert In Chennai, Tiruvallur, Other Districts Till July 22 | Forecast - thedailyjagran.com
article_text:
By Chetna Shree
Fri, 18 Jul 2025 07:58 AM (IST)
Source:JND
RELATED ARTICLES

Tamil Nadu Weather Update:  The India Meteorological Department (IMD) stated that several districts in Tamil Nadu, including Chennai, Tiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Ranipet, Vellore, Tiruvannamalai, and Chengalpattu, are expected to receive heavy rainfall on July 18. The weather department has issued a yellow alert for heavy rain on Friday. The city is likely to witness heavy rain with cloudy skies today.

Tamil Nadu Weather: Heavy Rain Likely In THESE Areas

According to the latest forecast by IMD, heavy rainfall is likely in parts of Chennai, Tiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Ranipet, Vellore, Tiruvannamalai, and Chengalpattu on Friday. The Nilgiris and the Ghat regions of Coimbatore are under a heavy rainfall alert.

Chennai is likely to experience a maximum temperature of 37 degrees Celsius and a minimum temperature of 27 degrees Celsius today. Heavy rain with generally cloudy skies is expected throughout the day.

Moderate To Heavy Rain Is Expected To Continue Across Tamil Nadu

Moderate to heavy rain is likely to occur in several parts of Tamil Nadu, including Kancheepuram, Ranipet, Tiruvallur, Theni, Tenkasi, Dindigul, Kanniyakumari and Tirunelveli until July 22. As per the forecast, these areas will experience partly cloudy skies with moderate rain accompanied by thunderstorms over the weekend. Heavy rain is expected in Nilgris and the Coimbatore Ghat areas.

ALSO READ: Heavy Rain Lashes Parts Of Delhi-NCR Causing Traffic Snarls On Airport Route; Delhi Airport, IndiGo Issue Advisory | Watch

The maximum temperature is likely to hover around 35 degrees Celsius while the minimum temperature will hold steady at 27 degrees Celsius throughout the weekend.

Tamil Nadu Rain: Waterlogging And Traffic Snarls Expected In THESE Areas

As a yellow alert for heavy rain is in place, commuters may face waterlogging and traffic snarls on several key routes. Stretches such as GST Road near Chromepet, Velachery Main Road, parts of Mount Road, and areas around T Nagar, Perambur, and Pulianthope are particularly vulnerable. Interior lanes in localities like Madipakkam, Medavakkam, and Kolathur may also witness waterlogging.

Though the city’s civic body is on alert, commuters are advised to avoid low-lying areas and allow extra time for travel.

ALSO READ: Swachh Survekshan Survey: Kanpur Among India’s Top 15 Cleanest Cities, Third On Ganga Belt

title: Weather Update: Heavy rain is expected in these states for the next 3 days - Times Bull
article_text:
Monsoon Update: Monsoon clouds are moving across the country, where the temperature level is also falling. In many places, there is heavy rain with thunder, due to which the situation has worsened. The temperature dropped due to late-night rain in the capital, Delhi and surrounding areas, where people got relief from the humid heat. Life was affected due to late-night rain in the hilly areas of Himachal Pradesh and Uttarakhand.

At some places, the roads were closed due to the sliding of hill rocks. Drivers had to face traffic jams. Rain is not stopping in the northeastern states as well, due to which everyone is very upset. The Indian Meteorological Department has issued an alert of torrential rain in many states of the country. Where and what the weather will be, know in detail below.

Heavy rain warning in these states

According to the Meteorological Department, a rain alert has been announced in the southern states along with strong winds. There is a possibility of good rain in Tamil Nadu, Karnataka, Kerala and Andhra Pradesh. Fishermen have been asked to stay away from the coastal areas. The IMD has said that people should not go out unless it is necessary. Along with this, heavy rains are expected in some parts. Talking about July 18, i.e. today, torrential rains in the coastal parts of Karnataka can also become a disaster.

Here too, there will be heavy rains.

According to the Meteorological Department, theweatherd is likely to be very bad in most parts of North India. Rains are expected in most areas of Uttar Pradesh, Rajasthan and Haryana.

Heavy rains are also expected in Madhya Pradesh and Chhattisgarh of Central India for the next three to four days. At the same time, good rains are expected in Himachal Pradesh from 18 to 21 July. The rain craze can be seen in many districts of Uttarakhand as well.

Where will it rain?

According to the Meteorological Department, heavy rains are expected in West Bengal, Andaman and Nicobar Islands, Sikkim and Assam for three days. Apart from these, heavy rains are also expected in Meghalaya, Mizoram and Arunachal Pradesh. People here have also been asked to be cautious.

title: RED ALERT for Rajasthan, Karnataka, Kerala as Delhi-NCR braces for more rain today — IMD's Full weather forecast here - Mint
article_text:
Amid heavy rainfall at several regions across India during this monsoon season, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) issued weather warnings for several states. Predicting extremely heavy rainfall in Rajasthan, Karnataka and Kerala today, July 18, the weather department issued red alert for these states. Meanwhile, Tamil Nadu, West Uttar Pradesh and West Madhya Pradesh are on orange alert.
IMD in its latest weather bulletin stated, “Extremely heavy rainfall (≥21 cm) very likely at isolated places over Rajasthan on 18th July…over Kerala on 19th & 20th; Coastal Karnataka on 17th and South Interior Karnataka on 18th July.”
Warning against very heavy rainfall, IMD forecasted heavy showers in Uttarakhand between July 20 and 23, in West Uttar Pradesh on July 18, 20 and 21, and in Himachal Pradesh between July 21 and 23. Besides this, very heavy rainfall is likely in West Madhya Pradesh on July 18 and in Sub-Himalayan West Bengal and Sikkim on July 20.
Amid yellow alert for northeastern states, IMD stated, “Isolated heavy rainfall very likely over Arunachal Pradesh, Assam & Meghalaya, Nagaland & Tripura during 18th-22nd with very heavy rainfall over Meghalaya on 19th July.”
Furthermore, heavy precipitation will most likely hit Goa until July 23 and Ghat areas of Madhya Maharashtra between July 20 and 23.
Moving to weather forecast for West India, IMD said, “Isolated heavy rainfall very likely to continue over Madhya Pradesh on 18th and during 21st-23rd; Vidarbha, Chhattisgarh during 21st -23rd; Bihar during 20th-23rd; Sub-Himalayan West Bengal & Sikkim, Odisha during 19th- 23rd July.”
The national capital can brace for “light to moderate rain" today accompanied by generally cloudy sky, thunderstorm and lightning. The minimum and maximum temperature today will be 1 to 2 notches below normal. No weather alert for heavy rain is in place for Delhi-NCR today, neither for coming 4-5 days but wet spells will continue till June 23.

title: Chennai Weather Alert: KTCC To Get Heavy Rains For Next 3-4 Days - Oneindia
article_text:
Home / Chennai
Chennai Weather Alert: KTCC To Get Heavy Rains For Next 3-4 Days
By Prakash KL
 Published: Friday, July 18, 2025, 10:03 [IST]
  

Tamil Nadu Weather News: The Chennai City and parts of the KTCC (Kanchipuram, Tiruvallur, Chennai, Chengalpattu) will witness heavy rains in the next three to four days.

RMC Issues Yellow Alert

The Regional Meteorological Centre has issued a yellow alert for Chennai and neighbouring regions. Kanchipuram, Tiruvallur, Chennai, Chengalpattu, Villupuram, Tenkasi, Tirunelveli, and Kanyakumari are expected to get heavy rains.

"Under favourable conditions widespread rains likely over Peninsular India. For the next three-four days north Tamil Nadu things look good for thunderstorms. Hopefully Chennai and suburbs will get at least one day of widespread rains," weather blogger Chennai Rains said in a post on X.

Another blogger Tamil Nadu Weather Man said, "KTCC (Chennai) Rain update - next few days we will be getting very good thunderstorms in coming 4-5 days including today.
Today storms are perfectly circling Chennai and should grow in size nearing Chennai and give very good spell in the next 1-2 hours.
Enjoy the spells."

Meanwhile, the Regional Meteorological Centre (RMC) has reported active Southwest Monsoon conditions across Kerala, coastal and South Interior Karnataka, and the Western Ghats districts of Tamil Nadu.

Recommended For You

This weather pattern is influenced by an east-west trough positioned roughly above sea level, and an upper air cyclonic circulation over North Interior Karnataka and its surrounding areas.

Consequently, the RMC has issued an orange alert, indicating very heavy rainfall, for the Nilgiris and Western Ghat areas of Coimbatore on July 18, 19, and 20.

Recent rainfall data shows significant precipitation, with Avalanche in the Nilgiris recording 11.8 cm and Chinnakalar in Coimbatore receiving 11.2 cm of rainfall in a single day. Vint Worth Estate in Nilgiris and Cincona in Coimbatore also experienced substantial rainfall, with 8.4 cm and 8.2 cm respectively.

article_text:
A depression over southeast Uttar Pradesh is expected to move toward north Madhya Pradesh, bringing extremely heavy rainfall to central India. (Photo Source: Pexels)

India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued widespread alerts as monsoon activity intensifies across the country. An active monsoon trough, along with several weather systems including a depression over southeast Uttar Pradesh, is expected to bring heavy to very heavy rainfall to many regions. Northern and central states like Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, and Rajasthan are likely to witness intense showers in the coming days. Meanwhile, southern states such as Kerala, Karnataka, and Tamil Nadu are also set to receive continuous heavy rainfall, with isolated extremely heavy spells expected in parts of Kerala and Karnataka. Here are the details

Northwest India to Witness Intense Monsoon Showers

A well-marked low-pressure area over southeast Uttar Pradesh, which intensified into a depression, is currently near Prayagraj. It is expected to move across southern Uttar Pradesh and northern Madhya Pradesh over the next two days, triggering intense rains in the region.

The IMD's forecasts highlight the possibility of extremely heavy rainfall in Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, and Kerala, with other states likely to experience thunderstorms and gusty winds. Authorities and residents in affected areas are urged to stay alert, avoid waterlogged zones, and follow local advisories for safety.

title: IMD Rain Alert: Big news! Very heavy rains in 15 states from 18 to 22 July, high alert issued - businessleague.in
article_text:
HomePersonal FinanceIMD Rain Alert: Big news! Very heavy rains in 15 states from...
Personal Finance
IMD Rain Alert: Big news! Very heavy rains in 15 states from 18 to 22 July, high alert issued
By
Pravesh Maurya
July 18, 2025
0
193
Share
IMD Rain Alert: Big news! Very heavy rains in 15 states from 18 to 22 July, high alert issued
- Advertisement -
- Advertisement -
Heavy Rain Warning: The India Meteorological Department has predicted that many parts of the country may receive heavy to very heavy rains for the next seven days. The Meteorological Department has said that the monsoon can have a strong effect across the country this week.

Heavy Rain Warning: Two low pressure areas have formed in two places of the country. One is in northwest Rajasthan and adjoining areas and the other is in southwest Bihar and adjoining eastern Uttar Pradesh. Due to this, very heavy rains are likely in more than 15 states in the coming days.

According to the Meteorological Department, very heavy rains may occur in many areas of eastern, northern, northeastern, western, central and southern India this week.

According to the Meteorological Department, heavy rains may continue today in many other areas including Bihar, Chhattisgarh, eastern Uttar Pradesh, Jammu and Kashmir, Jharkhand, Kerala and Mahe, Punjab, Uttarakhand.

According to the Meteorological Department, heavy to very heavy rainfall is likely to continue in Kerala, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu during the next 6 to 7 days.

The Meteorological Department said that heavy rains are likely at some places in Jammu and Kashmir, Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Uttar Pradesh during July 17 to 22.

Heavy rains may occur in Punjab, Haryana on July 17, 21 and 22. Very heavy rains are likely in East Rajasthan, North Punjab, Uttarakhand, Western Uttar Pradesh, East Uttar Pradesh, Himachal Pradesh today.

According to the IMD, heavy rains are likely in West Madhya Pradesh during today (July 18). Apart from this, heavy to very heavy rains may occur in Bihar, Andaman and Nicobar Islands, Odisha, Sub-Himalayan West Bengal and Sikkim on July 17, 20 and 21.

According to the Meteorological Department, light to moderate rains with thunder and lightning are likely to continue at many places in Northeast India during the next 7 days. Heavy rains are likely at some places in Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Meghalaya during July 19 to 22.

title: मॉनसून राहत भी आफत भी; देश के कई राज्यों में भारी बारिश की संभावना, IMD का अलर्ट जारी - Kisan Tak
article_text:
पूरे देश में इन दिनों मॉनसून का दौर जारी है. इस दौरान कई राज्यों में बादल आफत बनकर बरस रहे हैं, जिससे नदियां उफान पर हैं. ये बारिश जहां एक ओर आम आदमी के लिए आफत साबित हो रही है वहीं, दूसरी ओर खेती-किसानी के लिहाज से यह बारिश बेहद जरूरी भी है. दरअसल, इन दिनों उत्तर भारत में मौसम सुहावना बना हुआ है, जिससे लोगों को भीषण गर्मी से राहत मिली है. वहीं, भारतीय मौसम विज्ञान विभाग के पूर्वानुमान के अनुसार, आज यानी 18 जुलाई से इस सप्ताह के अंत तक उत्तर प्रदेश, बिहार, राजस्थान, दिल्ली-NCR, हिमाचल सहित दक्षिण भारत में तेज आंधी और गरज-चमक के साथ भारी बारिश की संभावना जताई गई है. ऐसे में आइए जानते हैं आज के मौसम का हाल.
दिल्ली-एनसीआर के अलग-अलग हिस्सों में रुक-रुक कर हो रही बारिश के चलते तापमान में गिरावट दर्ज की गई है. फिलहाल, राजधानी समेत आसपास के क्षेत्रों में बादलों की आवाजाही बनी हुई है. ऐसे में मौसम विभाग के मुताबिक, 23 जुलाई तक बारिश का दौर दिल्ली एनसीआर में जारी रहने की संभावना है. इस दौरान अधिकतम तापमान लगभग 34 डिग्री सेल्सियस और न्यूनतम तापमान 25 डिग्री सेल्सियस के आसपास रहने का अनुमान है.
उत्तर प्रदेश में अगले 48 घंटे के भीतर भारी से भारी बारिश होने की चेतावनी जारी की गई है. इस दौरान तेज हवाएं चल सकती हैं, जिनकी गति 50 से 60 किलोमीटर प्रति घंटा तक हो सकती है. वहीं, कई जिलों में बाढ़ की भी आशंका जताई गई है. इसके अलावा 18 जुलाई यानी शुक्रवार को पूर्वी और पश्चिमी यूपी के 32 से अधिक जिलों में आकाशीय बिजली गिरने की संभावना है. इनमें बरेली, रामपुर, प्रयागराज, फतेहपुर, बागपत, मेरठ, इटावा, हापुड़, गाजियाबाद, नोएडा, लखनऊ, रायबरेली, अमेठी, मैनपुरी, अमरोहा, मुरादाबाद, एटा, मुजफ्फरनगर और सहारनपुर शामिल हैं.
पिछले दो से तीन दिनों के दौरान बिहार में मॉनसून का रौद्र रूप देखने को मिल रहा है. बुधवार और गुरुवार को तो बारिश ने ऐसा तांडव मचाया कि लोग परेशान हो गए थे. हालांकि, खेती किसानी के लिहाज से यह बारिश बेहद जरूरी थी, लेकिन दुर्भाग्यवश इसमें 19 लोगों की जान आकाशीय बिजली गिरने से चली गई. गुरुवार को कई जिलों में भारी बारिश रिकॉर्ड की गई. लेकिन अब बिहार के लोगों को बारिश के कहर से अगले दो दिनों तक राहत मिलने की उम्मीद है.आईएमडी के अनुसार आज से 20 जुलाई तक बिहार में कोई चेतावनी जारी नहीं की गई है. बस कुछ जिलों में हल्की-हल्की बारिश देखने को मिल सकती है.
हिमाचल प्रदेश में मौसम विभाग ने आज से अगले 3 दिनों तक भारी बारिश की चेतावनी जारी की है. मौसम विभाग के पूर्वानुमान के मुताबिक, आज कई जिलों में भारी बारिश होने  की संभावना है और इसके लिए येलो अलर्ट भी जारी किया गया है. आज से 21 जुलाई तक हिमाचल के कई जिलों में भारी बारिश होने का अलर्ट है, जिसे देखते हुए कुछ जिलों में लोगों को बेहद सतर्क रहने की सलाह दी गई है. वहीं, उत्तराखंड और जम्मू-कश्मीर जैसे पहाड़ी राज्यों में भी बादल फटने, बाढ़ और भूस्खलन का खतरा अभी भी बना हुआ है. कुछ इलाकों में आकाशीय बिजली गिरने और ओले पड़ने की भी आशंका है.
दक्षिण भारत में मॉनसून का विकराल रूप देखने को मिल रहा है. कर्नाटक, तमिलनाडु, तेलंगाना, आंध्र प्रदेश और केरल में भारी बारिश के कारण नदियों का जलस्तर तेजी से बढ़ गया है. पूर्वोत्तर भारत में भी बारिश का सिलसिला जारी है. मौसम विभाग ने अगले 24 घंटों के लिए असम, अरुणाचल प्रदेश, पश्चिम बंगाल, सिक्किम, ओडिशा, झारखंड, गुजरात, महाराष्ट्र और छत्तीसगढ़ में भारी बारिश का अलर्ट जारी किया है.

title: Weather Update : राजस्थान के 17 जिलों में आज भी भारी बारिश का अलर्ट जारी, कल कैसा रहेगा मौसम, जानें - Patrika News
article_text:
Weather Update : राजस्थान के कई जिलों में बारिश का दौर जारी है। पूर्वी राजस्थान में मानसून सक्रिय है। इसके असर से शुक्रवार को कोटा, अजमेर व जोधपुर संभाग के 17 जिलों में मौसम केन्द्र ने अतिभारी बारिश का अलर्ट जारी किया है।
मौसम विभाग के अनुसार बीते 24 घंटे में गुरुवार को कोटा जिले के रामगंजमंडी, खैराबाद, कुदायला में करीब पांच घंटे में साढ़े सात इंच बरसात दर्ज की गई। इससे सामान्य जनजीवन को बुरी तरह प्रभावित किया। निचली बस्तियों के घरों में पानी भर गया तो जीएसएस में पानी भरने से बिजली आपूर्ति छह घंटे से अधिक समय तक बंद रही।
मौसम केन्द्र के अनुसार बिहार के ऊपर बना कम दबाव का क्षेत्र तीव्र होकर अवदाब में परिवर्तित हो चुका है तथा वर्तमान में दक्षिण-पूर्वी उत्तर प्रदेश के ऊपर अवस्थित है। इसके आगामी 48 घंटों में धीरे-धीरे आगे बढ़ने की आशंका है। यह तंत्र शुक्रवार को पूर्वी राजस्थान में सर्वाधिक प्रभावी रहेगा।
मौसम केन्द्र के अनुसार जोधपुर, बीकानेर व अजमेर संभाग में 19 जुलाई को कहीं-कहीं भारी बारिश व शेष भागों में हल्के से मध्यम बारिश होने की आशंका है। राज्य में 20 जुलाई से भारी बारिश की गतिविधियों में कमी दर्ज होने की संभावना है।

title: Rajasthan Weather News: प्रदेश के कई जिले टापू बने, फिर भारी बारिश की चेतावनी, इन जिलों के लिए रेड अलर्ट जारी - Amar Ujala
article_text:
Rajasthan Weather News: प्रदेश के कई जिले टापू बने, फिर भारी बारिश की चेतावनी, इन जिलों के लिए रेड अलर्ट जारी
न्यूज डेस्क, अमर उजाला, राजस्थान Published by: अर्पित याज्ञनिक Updated Fri, 18 Jul 2025 07:33 AM IST
सार
3532 Followers
जयपुर
बंगाल की खाड़ी में बना लो-प्रेशन सिस्टम तेज होकर डिप्रेशन में बदल चुका है। इसका सबसे ज्यादा असर आज शुक्रवार को देखने को मिलेगा। इसके प्रभाव से राजस्थान में आज अत्यन्त भारी बारिश का पूर्वानुमान जारी किया गया है।
भारी बारिश में कोटा बैराज की तस्वीर। - फोटो : अमर उजाला
विस्तार
Follow Us

राजस्थान के 6 जिलों में आज अत्यन्त भारी वर्षा की चेतावनी जारी की गई है। मौसम विभाग का कहना है कि बंगाल की खाड़ी में बना लो-प्रेशन सिस्टम तेज होकर डिप्रेशन में बदल चुका है। इसका सबसे ज्यादा असर आज शुक्रवार को देखने को मिलेगा। इसके चलते प्रदेश जिलों में आज बारिश का अलर्ट है इनमें आईएमडी ने अजमेर, भीलवाड़ा, बूंदी, कोटा, टोंक और पाली में अत्यन्त भारी वर्षा का रेड अलर्ट जारी किया गया है। वहीं प्रतापगढ़, बारां, चित्तौड़गढ़, झालवाड़, राजसमंद, सवाई माधोपुर, सिरोही, उदयपुर और नागौर में अति भारी वर्षा का ओरेंज अलर्ट जारी हुआ है। 

Trending Videos


मौसम विभाग के अनुसार आज पूर्वी राजस्थान में मानसून सबसे ज्यादा एक्टिव स्थिति में है। वहीं बीते 24 घंटों के दौरान पाली, सवाई माधोपुर, हनुमानगढ़, गंगानगर, जोधपुर, करौली, झालावाड़, बारां, चूरू, झुंझुनूं, दौसा समेत कई जिलों में हल्की से मध्यम और कहीं-कहीं भारी बारिश हुई। इस बीच तेज बारिश से जान-माल का भी नुकसान हो रहा है। बीते 4 दिन में बारिश से हुए हादसों में 21 लोगों की मौत हुई है। गुरुवार को कोटा में एक युवक नाले में बह गया। झालावाड़ जिले में कई गांव टापू बन गए हैं।
विज्ञापन


ये भी पढ़ें- सरकारी अस्पताल में कार्यरत नर्स की संदिग्ध हालात में मौत, पीहर पक्ष ने लगाया दहेज हत्या का आरोप


हनुमानगढ़ के पीलीबंगा एरिया में गुरुवार को सबसे ज्यादा 110MM बारिश दर्ज हुई। हनुमानगढ़ के ही भादरा में 66MM, गोलूवाला में 44MM, पाली के जैतारण में 50MM, फलोदी के पास आऊ में 89MM बारिश हुई। बारां के अटरू में 79MM, मांगरोल में 59MM, बीकानेर के जसरासर में 67MM, चूरू के बीदासर में 48MM बारिश हुई। इसके अलावा दौसा के निर्झरना में 83MM, झालावाड़ के झालरापाटन में 49MM पानी बरसा। पचपहाड़ में 48MM, झुंझुनूं के मंडाना में 75MM, करौली के कुडगांव में 73MM, करौली शहर में 43MM, कोटा के सांगोद में 97MM, कनवास में 73MM, मांडना में 50MM, राजसमंद के देवगढ़ में 42MM और सवाई माधोपुर के बौंली में 53MM बारिश दर्ज हुई।

title: Weather Update: Red Alert For Torrential Rain In UP, Kerala; Rajasthan Braces For Heavy Rainfall; Check Forecast For Delhi, Other States - thedailyjagran.com
article_text:
By Shibra Arshad
Fri, 18 Jul 2025 08:11 AM (IST)
Source:JND
RELATED ARTICLES

Weather News: As the monsoon is active across the country, multiple states are experiencing pleasant weather due to heavy rainfall, while several others are enduring the havoc of rain. Delhi and NCR districts are still awaiting steady rainfall. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued red and orange alerts in UP, Kerala has also been placed under red alert for torrential rainfall, as the Kozhikode district faced incidents of landslides. 

Red Alert In 6 UP Districts, 7 Other Places Under Orange Warning

The weather department has issued alerts for multiple districts in Uttar Pradesh, including Lalitpur, Jhansi, Mahoba, Banda, Chitrakoot, and Prayagraj, warning of extremely heavy rainfall and thunderstorms accompanied by lightning on Friday.

An orange alert has been issued for Jalaun, Hamirpur, Fatehpur, Kaushambi, Sant Ravidas Nagar, Mirzapur, and Sonbhadra, indicating very heavy rainfall with strong winds expected at speeds of 30-50 km/h.

Kerala On Red Alert For Torrential Rain After Kozhikode Landslides

Heavy rainfall has wreaked havoc in Kerala, as incidents of Landslides were registered in Kozhikode district on Thursday, inundating multiple homes. The rising water levels in rivers like Uppala, Manjeswaram, Madhur, and Puthige in the Kasaragod district have prompted authorities to issue warnings for residents living along the riverbanks.

ALSO READ: Swachh Survekshan Survey: Kanpur Among India’s Top 15 Cleanest Cities, Third On Ganga Belt

The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a 'Red' alert for Kozhikode, Wayanad, Kannur, and Kasaragod districts due to persistent heavy rainfall. The alert will remain in effect for:

Wayanad, Kannur, and Kasaragod districts for the next three days

Kozhikode district on July 19 and 20

Malappuram district on July 20

Heavy Rain In Rajasthan As North West Braces For Isolated Downpour

Extremely heavy rainfall at isolated places exceeding 21 cm is expected to better Rajasthan on Friday. Isolated heavy to very heavy rains are forecast over Jammu & Kashmir, Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, and East Uttar Pradesh from July 18 to 23.

While residents in Delhi and NCR continue to enjoy intermittent rainfall, but still await steady rainfall as patchy rain contributed to heightened humidity and uncomfortable conditions. 

ALSO READ: 'Lawbreakers': Kunal Kamra Takes Satirical Jibe At Brawl Between Workers Of BJP, NCP In Maharashtra Legislature | Watch

Isolated heavy to hefty rainfall is likely across Tamil Nadu, Karnataka, Coastal Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, and Lakshadweep throughout the week.

title: Schools shut in Ajmer, heavy rain alert in 6 districts: Hanumangarh records 4 inches of rainfall; Jhalawar ... - Bhaskar English
article_text:
English News

Local

Rajasthan

Houses & Vehicles Submerged In Pushkar; Ajmer Schools Shut: Villagers Welcome Luni River With Drums & Songs; Gates Of Kota Barrage Opened

Rajasthan Monsoon Flood-like situation in Pushkar, hospitals & markets submerged in Ajmer: Students on their way to school cross swollen river in Pali; gates of Kota dam opened

Jaipur 2 minutes ago



Copy link

The low-pressure system formed over the Bay of Bengal has now intensified into a depression. Due to its impact, several districts in Rajasthan’s Kota, Ajmer, Jodhpur, and Udaipur divisions are likely to experience heavy to very heavy rainfall starting today.

A rain alert has been issued for a total of 23 districts, with a red alert in 6 of them. As a result of the system, Ajmer and Pushkar have been witnessing heavy rainfall since Friday morning, prompting the district collector to declare a holiday in schools.

In Pushkar, continuous downpour for several hours has led to flood-like conditions. Shops and homes in the main market area are submerged, and vehicles can be seen floating on the roads.

In Kota, following continuous rainfall, the gates of the Kota Barrage have been opened again today to release excess water. Meanwhile, in Sikar, around 20 minutes of intense rain in the morning has led to waterlogging in areas such as Nawalgarh Road and Loharu Bus Stand.

Most parts of Pushkar city are submerged in water. Civil defence teams are working to rescue not just people, but also animals. A family along with their two pet dogs was rescued by the teams.

Heavy Rain lashes Ajmer & Pushkar

Amid a heavy rainfall alert, Ajmer and Pushkar witnessed continuous downpour since Friday morning. In view of the India Meteorological Department’s red alert, Ajmer District Collector Lokbandhu ordered the closure of schools for the day.

In Pushkar, several low-lying areas including Varaha Ghat, Narsingh Ghat, Purana Ganji Mandir, Mali Mohalla, Mishra Ka Mohalla, Savitri Road, and the Gurudwara area were submerged. In Sikar city as well, heavy morning rain led to waterlogging in the main markets.

Besides Ajmer, the weather department has issued warnings of extremely heavy rainfall today in Kota, Bundi, Tonk, Bhilwara, and Pali districts.

Over the past four days, 21 people have lost their lives in rain-related incidents across Rajasthan, with the highest number of deaths reported from Kota.

Visuals of rain from across different districts of Rajasthan..

In Ajmer, heavy rain for three consecutive hours caused waterlogging in multiple areas, creating problems for residents.

Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla took stock of rain-affected areas in Kota’s Ramganj Mandi region by riding a tractor.

In Bundi’s Nainwa area, Simidhi village was cut off from Nainwa and Karwar due to overflowing seasonal streams on both sides. People are crossing the waterlogged streams on tractors.

In Lakheri, Bundi, heavy rain for about an hour led to waterlogging in the town’s streets.

In Hanumangarh district’s Bhadra area, over 2.5 inches of rain fell on Thursday. Water even entered the district hospital during this time.

Dhaba village in Jhalawar was completely submerged in Thursday morning’s rainfall. People were stranded on the rooftops of their homes.

.

title: "Avoid waterlogged areas": Ajmer Municipal Corporation Health Officer Prithviraj Singh on Rajasthan's heavy rains - The News Mill
article_text:
“Avoid waterlogged areas”: Ajmer Municipal Corporation Health Officer Prithviraj Singh on Rajasthan’s heavy rains

Written By: ANI

| Published on: Jul 18, 2025

ANI Photo | “Avoid waterlogged areas”: Ajmer Municipal Corporation Health Officer Prithviraj Singh on Rajasthan’s heavy rains

Rajasthan experienced heavy rainfall, causing waterlogging in several parts of Ajmer city today. Ajmer Municipal Corporation Health Officer Prithviraj Singh appealed to the public to remain at home and avoid areas with waterlogging.
Prithviraj Singh said, “Today’s red alert has been announced by the weather department. All the common people are asked to remain in their homes. Where there is excessive water, the general public is aware of all the affected areas; therefore, they should avoid going out there and pay special attention to those places.”
He also stated that, in accordance with the Municipal Commissioner’s directions, various teams, including engineers, sanitation workers, and healthcare workers, are visiting all areas where waterlogging occurs regularly.
“Our teams are stationed at all the places where water is filled on a regular basis, Brahampuri, Sunheri Colony, Aam Ka Talab, and New Govind Nagar. Wherever there is a complaint of water stagnation or a broken valve, our team is present and efforts are being made to resolve the issue. Also, wherever there is a requirement for soil cuttings, or a valve is broken, soil cuttings are immediately sent from the control room,” Singh added.
He also urged the general public, residents of Ajmer Corporation, and the City Corporation to avoid the area with waterlogging problems and refrain from travelling.
The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a warning of “extremely heavy rain” red alerts for east and west Rajasthan.
According to the IMD, Heavy rainfall of 79 mm is expected today at Ajmer with a maximum temperature of 29 degrees and a minimum of 22.5 degrees.
Meanwhile, the IMD said, the depression over northwest Madhya Pradesh and adjoining Southwest Uttar Pradesh moved west-northwestwards with a speed of 17 kmph during past 6 hours and lay centred at 0530 hrs IST of July 18 over northwest Madhya Pradesh abd adjoining Southwest Uttar Pradesh, near latitude 26.3°N and longitude 79.0°E, 20 km southof Etawah, 80 km east of Gwalior, 120 km east-southeast of Dholpur and 140 km southeast of Agra. It is likely to move west-northwestwards across northwest Madhya Pradesh and east Rajasthan during next 24 hours.

title: Flood situation worsens in Madhya Pradesh, exams stand cancelled: Roads collapse in many areas; heavy rain ... - Bhaskar English
article_text:
English News

Local

Mp

Bhopal

Floods Batter Mp Exams Cancelled Roads Collapse 15 Districts Rain Alert Gwalior Chambal Heavy Rainfall Today

MP Monsoon Heavy rains trap 200 families in Chhatarpur district: Schools closed in 4 districts; highway blocked in Tikamgarh as floodwaters rise

Bhopal a few seconds ago



Copy link

In this monsoon season, Madhya Pradesh has received an average rainfall of 19.2 inches while it was supposed to receive 11.5 inches of rain till now

Heavy rain hits 26 districts, colleges cancel exams, roads collapse

Flash flood alert issued, schools shut in 4 districts

Dams filling fast; Madhya Pradesh records 7.7 inches excess rain

Several districts of Madhya Pradesh are facing flood-like conditions again because of the monsoon trough and a depression in the weather.

On Thursday, it rained heavily in more than 26 districts, including Satna, Dindori, and Mauganj. Rivers and drains overflowed, forcing colleges to cancel exams.

Two labourers die in Shahdol

In Shahdol, soil caved in during sewer line digging, burying two labourers. Both of them died. In Bhopal, waterlogging affected roads.

Heavy rain alert in Gwalior-Chambal today

The weather department has issued an alert for very heavy rainfall in seven districts of the Gwalior-Chambal region on Friday.

These include Gwalior, Morena, Bhind, Sheopur, Shivpuri, Datia, and Ashok Nagar.

Pictures of rain in the state

More rain expected in many other districts

Heavy rain is also expected in Neemuch, Mandsaur, Ratlam, Agar-Malwa, Rajgarh, Vidisha, Sagar, Damoh, Niwari, Chhatarpur, Panna, Satna, Rewa, and Mauganj.

Schools shut in four districts

Due to the weather, schools will remain closed on Friday in Rewa, Satna, Dindori, and Mauganj.

Flash flood warning issued

The Meteorological Department has warned of sudden floods in Chhatarpur, Damoh, Katni, Panna, Sagar, Satna, and Tikamgarh. There is also flood risk in Ashok Nagar, Datia, Guna, Gwalior, Morena, Rajgarh, Sheopur, Shivpuri, and Vidisha.

Rainfall much higher than normal

So far in this monsoon season, Madhya Pradesh has received 19.2 inches of rain. Normally, only 11.5 inches of rain is expected by this time. This means there has been 7.7 inches of extra rainfall.

Flood-like situation in eastern part of state The state experienced flood-like conditions on Thursday. In Satna, 95 mm or 3.8 inches of rain fell within 9 hours.

Rewa received 2.3 inches, Khajuraho-Tikamgarh 1.7 inches, Gwalior, Mandla, Naugaon and Pachmarhi received three-quarters of an inch, while Bhopal, Sidhi and Jabalpur received half an inch of rain.

Similarly, rainfall continued in many districts including Datia, Guna, Narmadapuram, Shivpuri, Damoh, Narsinghpur, Sagar, Seoni, Umaria, Balaghat, Mauganj, Harda, Mandsaur, Rajgarh, Shajapur, Vidisha, Agar-Malwa, and Sehore.

Road collapsed, car washed away One hour of heavy rain in Bhopal created waterlogging conditions. A large pothole formed when the road caved in near Board Office intersection. A sewage line runs beneath this section of the road.

In Satna, examinations scheduled for July 17, 18 and 19 at Government Autonomous College were postponed.

In Dindori, government schools remained closed on Thursday due to excessive rainfall. All schools in Mauganj also remained closed.

A policeman's car was washed away in the Matkuli river in Harda.

He saved his life by jumping out of the car in time. In Satna, a car was swept away in strong currents while trying to cross a low bridge. People safely rescued the young man from the car.

Water entered several houses in Nai Garhi town of Mauganj district.

People moved to safer places with essential items. The police station premises also remained submerged. Water is flowing with strong current in the Gupt Godavari cave of Chitrakoot. The cave has been closed for tourists.

Water level rising rapidly in dams There are total 54 large dams in the state, where water inflow is happening rapidly.

Water levels have increased in Bansagar, Barna, Gandhisagar, Gopikrishna, Indra Sagar, Kerwa, Kaliyasot, Kolar, Kundaliya, Kushalpura, Mohanpura, Omkareshwar, Rajghat, Bargi, Sanjay Sagar, Tawa, Tiller, Tighra, Pench, Satpura and other dams.

Bhopal's Upper Lake has also received good water inflow. Once water level rises by 6.5 feet, the lake will overflow, then Bhadbhada dam gates will need to be opened.

.

title: Rain triggers flood-like conditions in several areas of Bihar: Lightning strikes kill 17 in 9 districts; fa... - Bhaskar English
article_text:
English News

Local

Bihar

Rain Triggers Flood like Conditions In Several Areas Of Bihar Lightning Strikes Kill 17 In 9 Districts Farmers In Patna Build Tin Boats For Survival

Bihar Monsoon Rain triggers flood-like conditions in several areas of Bihar: Lightning strikes kill 17 in 9 districts; farmers in Patna build tin boats for survival

Patna 32 minutes ago



Copy link

The monsoon is active in Bihar and heavy rains have been occurring in many districts of the state for the past three-four days. This has created flood-like conditions in many districts. 17 people died in 9 districts due to lightning strikes.

The Meteorological Center has issued a forecast for the next two weeks. According to the Meteorological Center, light to heavy rainfall is likely in most parts of the southern and northeastern parts of the state from July 18 to 24. Meanwhile, light rain may occur in the remaining parts.

Also, from July 25 to 30, light to heavy rainfall is likely in some districts of the southern parts of the state. Light rain may occur in the remaining parts.

Bihar weather-related pictures

Due to continuous rainfall in the Kaimur hill area, flood-like conditions have developed in the waterfall.

Houses have been flooded due to embankment breaches at several places in the Falgu river in Jehanabad.

After heavy rain in Kaimur, the road is filled with 2 feet of water. Teachers walking while holding each other's hands.

17 deaths from lightning strikes in 24 hours

Heavy rain occurred in 10 districts on Thursday. Due to lightning strikes, 17 people died in 9 districts. The highest number of deaths occurred in Sheikhpura where four people including a grandmother and grandchild died.

Three people died in Bhagalpur. Meanwhile, 2 people died in Patna's Baarh and Khusrupur areas. One person died in Kauakol of Nawada. A young man died due to lightning strike in Badhar of Kanchan Tola village in Kachwa police station area of Rohtas district.

While a woman died in Tarari of Bhojpur district. In separate incidents, a woman and a young man lost their lives after being struck by lightning in Aurangabad.

Lalan Rai (40) died in Bhalui village of Rajapakar in Vaishali and a 22-year-old youth died in Pokharera Chausaj village of Baikunthpur panchayat.

In Onda village of Asthawan in Nalanda, an elderly man died on the spot when lightning struck while grazing cattle, while two women were seriously burned.

Clouds to remain in Patna today

Light to heavy rain occurred in Patna on Wednesday and Thursday. According to the Meteorological Center, clouds will remain in the sky on Friday and light to heavy rain may occur.

The maximum temperature in the capital is likely to remain around 34 to 36 degrees Celsius and the minimum temperature around 27 degrees Celsius. Wind speed could be 10 to 12 kilometers per hour.

title: Rain to continue across Odisha for 5 days, yellow alert issued for 22 districts: IMD - Odisha TV
article_text:
The Bhubaneswar Meteorological Centre predicts continuous rainfall in Odisha for five days, with a yellow alert issued for 22 districts. Coastal areas may remain dry.
Heavy rainfall predicted across Odisha
Rainfall is expected to persist across Odisha for the next five days, according to the Bhubaneswar Meteorological Centre. While most parts of the state are likely to witness heavy rain during this period, a few coastal districts are likely to remain dry.
The weather office issued a yellow warning for 22 districts on Friday. As per the forecast, heavy rainfall is likely over the western, southern, and northern regions of Odisha. However, rainfall is not anticipated in a few areas.
According to the Bhubaneswar Meteorological Centre, eight coastal districts, Puri, Khordha, Nayagarh, Cuttack, Jagatsinghpur, Kendrapara, Jajpur, and Bhadrak, may not experience rainfall. Apart from these, all other districts are expected to receive rain over the coming days.
Southern Odisha is likely to receive heavy showers on Saturday. The forecast also mentions surface winds with speeds ranging between 30 to 40 kilometres per hour. These conditions may affect areas already experiencing moderate rainfall.
The Bhubaneswar Met Centre has further predicted the possibility of rainfall accompanied by thunder and lightning in isolated places across the state. These developments are being closely monitored as part of the extended weather outlook.

title: Flood Havoc in Kendrapara: Villages Submerged, Connectivity Severed - Pragativadi
article_text:
Home » Flood Havoc in Kendrapara: Villages Submerged, Connectivity Severed
A
severe flood situation has gripped Kendrapara district as the Kharasrota, Brahmani, and Kani rivers overflowed following heavy rainfall.
The rising water levels have inundated low-lying areas, leaving several villages submerged and thousands of residents stranded.
Connectivity has been completely disrupted in multiple blocks, including Rajnagar, Ali, and Pattamundai. Roads are under water, and locals are now relying on boats to move between villages. In the Rajnagar block alone, nearly 30 villages have been cut off from the outside world.
Ali block has reported extensive damage, with 12 panchayats affected by floodwaters. The Manpur-Gobindpur road is submerged under nearly 7 feet of water, making vehicular movement impossible.
Residents are in distress as floodwaters have entered homes, schools, and health centres. Agricultural lands have been submerged, raising concerns about crop loss and food security. The administration has initiated relief measures, including the distribution of dry food, the opening of shelters, and the deployment of rescue teams.
Authorities from the Water Resources Department and the district administration are on high alert. Efforts are underway to repair embankments and restore connectivity. Rescue operations are being supported by ODRAF, NDRF, and fire services.
As the situation remains tense, officials expect water levels to recede in the next 6–12 hours. However, concerns over waterborne diseases and clean drinking water persist.

title: लैंडस्लाइड, बाढ़, बादल फटना... मॉनसून में टूरिस्ट्स के लिए खतरनाक हो जाते हैं ये हिल स्टेशन! घूमने से पहले... - Zee News
article_text:
बारिश के मौसम में अगर आपका भी हिल स्टेशनों पर घूमने का प्लान है तो आपके लिए कुछ हिल स्टेशन तो शानदार और अच्छे विकल्प हो सकते हैं. हालांकि कुछ हिल स्टेशनों पर घूमना खतरनाक साबित हो सकता है.
मॉनसून को घूमने के लिए अच्छा मौसम माना जाता है. काफी तादाद में लोग इस मौसम में हिल स्टेशनों को ट्रिप का हिस्सा बनाते हैं, क्योंकि इस मौसम में हिल स्टेशनों पर घूमने का अलग ही मजा है. ऐसे में अगर आपको भी इस मौसम में हिल स्टेशनों का रूख करना चाहते हैं तो रुक जाइए. दरअसल जरूरी नहीं है कि बारिश के मौसम में हिल स्टेशन सिर्फ खूबसूरत ही हों. दरअसल कुछ हिल स्टेशन इस मौसम में खतरनाक भी हो जाते हैं. उनकी नेचुरल ब्यूटी तो काफी शानदार रहता है, लेकिन वे बारिश के चलते काफी खतरनाक हो जाते हैं. आइए जानते हैं ऐसे ही कुछ हिल स्टेशनों के बारे में....
कुल्लू-मनाली
हिमाचल प्रदेश के सबसे बेहतरीन और आकर्षक हिल स्टेशनों में कुल्लू-मनाली का नाम शामिल है. दरअसल इन दोनों हिल स्टेशनों पर काफी तादाद में लोग घूमने आते हैं. हालांकि ये हिल स्टेशन जितने खूबसूरत हैं उतने ही खतरनाक साबित हो सकते हैं. दरअसल मॉनसूम में यहां काफी लैंडस्लाइड, बाढ़ और बादल फटने की दुर्घटनाएं भी हो सकती हैं. इसलिए मॉनसून में यहां जाने से पहले अच्छे से सोच लें.
दार्जिलिंग हिल स्टेशन
भारत के सबसे खूबसूरत हिल स्टेशनों में से एक दार्जिलिंग भी घूमने के लिए काफी शानदार है. हालांकि मॉनसून में यहां घूमना खतरनाक हो सकता है. दरअसल इस मौसम में यहां काफी बारिश होती है. ऐसे में यहां सबसे ज्यादा लैंडस्लाइड होते हैं. इससे कई रास्ते बंद हो जाते हैं. इसलिए यहां घूमने से पहले आपको एक बार जरूर सोचना चाहिए. बता दें कि जगह-जगह पर भूस्खलन होने के चलते अगस्त के महीने तक यहां घूमने के लिए मनाही की जाती है.
शिमला हिल स्टेशन
हिमाचल प्रदेश घूमने जाएं और शिमला का विजिट ना करें, ऐसा कैसे हो सकता है. दरअसल यह काफी खूबसूरत हिल स्टेशन है. हालांकि इस हिल स्टेशन पर भी मॉनसून में विजिट ना करने की सलाह दी जाती है. दरअसल बीते वर्ष शिमला और मंडी की कई जगहों पर भारी बाढ़ और लैंडस्लाइड हुई थी. इसके चलते यहां भारी नुकसान हुआ था. इसलिए इस मौसम में यहां भी घूमने के पहले आपको अच्छे से सोच लेना चाहिए, क्योंकि यहां तेजी से पहाड़ खिसकते हैं.

title: Meghalaya, Uttarakhand, Maharashtra, Karnataka, and Kerala Deliver the Ultimate Monsoon Escape Filled with Wild Landscapes and Stormy Skies - Travel And Tour World
article_text:
Meghalaya, Uttarakhand, Maharashtra, Karnataka, and Kerala each offer a distinct yet equally mesmerizing monsoon experience that transforms India’s terrain into a dramatic and photogenic escape. In Meghalaya, the rain becomes a way of life, carving deep valleys, veiling cliffs in mist, and fueling some of the world’s tallest waterfalls. Uttarakhand awakens with bursts of color in the Valley of Flowers, where Himalayan meadows bloom beneath shifting clouds and snow-capped backdrops. The Western Ghats of Maharashtra come alive with tumbling waterfalls, moss-covered forts, and sweeping panoramas veiled in fog. Meanwhile, Karnataka’s Coorg and Agumbe regions offer rich rainforest textures, roaring streams, and hidden wildlife framed by silver skies. Down south, Kerala turns into a painter’s canvas—its emerald backwaters, tea estates, and tribal villages soaked in tranquility and reflection.
If you’re looking to capture cascading waterfalls, brooding mountain peaks, or everyday life made poetic under rain-soaked skies, these seven monsoon destinations will immerse your lens in unforgettable stories.
India’s Wettest Corners Drenched in Beauty
These highland towns in Meghalaya hold global records for rainfall — and that rainfall sculpts the landscape into a living tapestry. Hills drip with greenery, hidden trails lead to ethereal living root bridges, and mist rolls across valleys like stage smoke. Nohkalikai Falls, one of India’s tallest waterfalls, becomes a powerful spectacle during the wettest months, framed by thick forests and shifting cloud layers.
Tucked away in the high-altitude reaches of Uttarakhand, the Valley of Flowers is a seasonal wonderland that comes alive with wild blooms between July and September. This remote Himalayan basin transforms into a multicolored carpet, with tiny blossoms stretching as far as the eye can see. Soft fog and distant snowy peaks create hauntingly beautiful frames — a perfect blend of color and contrast for both macro and landscape photographers.
Urban Escapes That Come Alive in the Rain
A favorite among city dwellers from Mumbai and Pune, these twin hill towns become a green paradise when the monsoon hits. Rolling hills turn lush, seasonal waterfalls spill over cliffs, and historic forts appear ghostly in the mist. Shooting from vantage points like Lion’s Point or Rajmachi reveals valleys veiled in fog and light-play that evolves by the minute. Rain here doesn’t dampen the spirit — it defines the view.
A Highlands Retreat of Coffee and Clouds
With its mist-covered coffee estates, thundering waterfalls, and winding forest trails, Coorg becomes a rich, textured landscape under monsoon skies. Photographers will find plenty to frame — from dew-speckled leaves at sunrise to storm clouds hovering over plantations. Locations like Abbey Falls and the panoramic Mandalpatti ridge offer moody compositions where light filters through the rain, creating visual depth and drama.
Reflections on Water and Culture
Kerala’s famed backwaters take on a deeper mystique during the rains. As boats glide silently across mirror-like waters, palm trees sway under grey skies, and locals move through quiet villages in colorful rain gear, the setting turns cinematic. The backwaters of Alleppey are ideal for capturing stillness and motion in the same frame — reflections in flooded paddy fields, ripples under a wooden canoe, or daily life slowed by the rain.
India’s Forgotten Rainforest Realm
Agumbe is not on every traveler’s list — but for photographers in search of raw, monsoon-drenched wilderness, it’s a revelation. Nicknamed the “Cherrapunji of the South,” Agumbe is a biodiversity hotspot, home to rare reptiles, giant trees, and gushing jungle streams. Early mornings often greet you with silver mist, golden rain, and the croaking of frogs echoing in the forest. It’s a dream location for macro and wildlife photography, especially in the peak rainy months.
A Cultural and Natural Tapestry in the Ghats
Set in the Western Ghats, Wayanad offers more than just scenery — it offers story. Rain revives its waterfalls, forests, and rice fields, while local life adapts to the rhythm of thunder and drizzle. Meenmutty and Soochipara Falls erupt in full force, tea gardens vanish into cloud banks, and tribal settlements reveal traditions untouched by time. Here, every photo becomes part of a broader narrative — of nature, people, and the monsoon’s imprint on both.
India’s monsoon does more than change how the land looks — it changes how the land feels. It deepens shadows, softens sunlight, and fills every scene with texture and life. For the photographer, these are not just weather conditions — they are ingredients for emotion.
From rain-slicked roads to ancient hills wrapped in fog, from villagers laughing under umbrellas to waterfalls roaring back to life, India in the rain is a country reborn. These destinations don’t just offer views; they offer vision.

title: Karnataka school holiday: IMD issues red alert, educational institutes shut in these districts - CNBC TV18
article_text:
Karnataka school holiday: IMD issues red alert, educational institutes shut in these districts
Karnataka school holiday: All schools and anganwadis in Udupi will be closed today due to heavy rain. According to an order issued by the Udupi District Commissioner, "Schools and Anganwadis will remain closed today due to heavy rain in the district."
By CNBCTV18.com 
July 18, 2025, 10:24:18 AM IST (Published)
2 Min Read
The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a red alert for several districts of Karnataka for Friday (July 18). Amid the heavy rain alert, schools, colleges and other educational institutions will remain shut in multiple districts on July 18.



Authorities in the districts of Udupi and Kodagu have declared a holiday for schools, colleges and anganwadi centres as heavy rains continue to affect the state.


In Kodagu district, schools and colleges in Madikeri, Virajpet, and Somwarpet will remain closed due to continuous heavy rain.




All schools and anganwadis in Udupi will be closed today due to heavy rain. According to an order issued by the Udupi District Commissioner, "Schools and Anganwadis will remain closed today due to heavy rain in the district," ANI reported.

The IMD has predicted isolated heavy to very heavy rainfall over Coastal and South Interior Karnataka, with isolated heavy rainfall over north Interior Karnataka during July 18 to 23. Light/moderate rainfall at many/some places over the state is predicted during the next seven days.

The IMD has also advised fishermen to avoid venturing into the Arabian Sea, along and off the Kerala and Karnataka coasts, until July 22 due to rough sea conditions.




In its latest weather bulletin, the IMD predicted extremely heavy rainfall (≥21 cm) at isolated places over South Interior Karnataka on Friday.

Meanwhile, the weather agency also issued a red alert for Rajasthan and Kerala on July 18.

title: Karnataka school holiday: Kodagu, Udupi districts shut educational institutions amid IMD's red alert for heavy rains - Mint
article_text:
Several educational institutions across Karnataka will remain closed today, July 18, amid India Meteorological Department's (IMD) red alert for heavy rains. Kodagu and Udupi district authorities announced the closure of schools as torrential rains continue to lash Karnataka.
Schools and colleges in Kodagu will remain closed today due to the heavy rain forecast. Kodagu District Commissioner in a statement said, “Holiday declared in schools and colleges in Madikeri, Virajpet and Somwarpet today, due to continuous heavy rain,” ANI reported. Hence, schools and colleges located in Madikeri, Virajpet and Somwarpet cities will observe a non-working day today.
Bengaluru Meteorological Centre in its weather report stated, “Heavy to Very heavy rain with sustained wind (40-50 kmph) likely to occur at a few places and Extremely Very heavy rain with sustained wind (40-50 kmph) likely to occur at one or two places over Kodagu district.”
Schools and Anganwadis will also remain closed in the Udupi district today. An order issued by the Udupi District Commissioner stated, "Schools and Anganwadis will remain closed today due to heavy rain in the district."
Heavy to very heavy rain with sustained wind (30-40 kmph) likely to occur at a few places over Dakshina Kannada and Udupi districts, the Meteorological Centre forecasted.
A rainfall warning has been issued for several Karnataka districts, including Bidar, Kalburgi, Yadgir, Raich, Bagalkot, Belagavi, Dharwad, Gadag, Haveri, Koppal, Vijayapu, Shivamogga, Chikkamagaluru, Mysuru, Hassan, Mandya, Chamarajanagara, Bengaluru (Rural), Bengaluru (Urban), Chikkaballapura, Kolara, Ramanagara, Ballari, Chitradurga, Davanagere, Tumakuru and Vijayanagara.
Besides Karnataka, a red alert has been issued for Rajasthan and Kerala. Meanwhile, Tamil Nadu, West Uttar Pradesh and West Madhya Pradesh are on orange alert today.
The IMD in its latest weather bulletin dated July 17 stated, “Extremely heavy rainfall (≥21 cm) very likely at isolated places over Rajasthan on 18th July…over Kerala on 19th & 20th; Coastal Karnataka on 17th and South Interior Karnataka on 18th July.”
A warning for fishermen has also been issued, advising them to avoid venturing into the Arabian Sea, along and off the Kerala and Karnataka coasts till July 22.

title: Bengaluru Weather: IMD Issues Yellow Alert In These Parts Of Karnataka; Check Temperatures & Humidity - MSN
article_text:
Bengaluru: Bengaluruians have been enjoying cool weather over the past few days. The city is set to experience heavy rainfall on June 30, 2025. Cloudy skies are also expected in the city, which is expected to remain the same throughout the day. The city woke up at 05: 55 AM. The minimum and maximum temperatures are expected to range from 21 degrees Celsius and 28 degrees Celsius, respectively. The city is expected to witness the sunset at 06: 49 PM.
KSNDMC shared a weather report on X
Karnataka State Natural Disaster Monitoring Centre (KSNDMC) shared a weather report on X (formerly Twitter) for seven days and wrote, "Scattered to widespread moderate rain and isolated heavy rain likely over coastal and Malnad districts of the state. Scattered light to moderate rain is likely over the interior districts."
Rainfall is predicted in these regions
The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a yellow alert for heavy rainfall on Monday in coastal and it's adjoining regions, North Interior Karnataka and South Interior Karnataka North Interior Karnataka and South Interior Karnataka. Scattered heavy rainfall is predicted in isolated regions of the state. The rainfall is likely to be accompanied by thunderstorms and lightning, and it is likely to continue for the next three to four days, said IMD.
Bengaluru Weather: IMD Issues Yellow Alert In These Regions Of Karnataka; Check More Details
Humidity levels may hover around 70-85 per cent, making the air feel damp, especially after rainfall. If you plan to step out, it's advisable to carry an umbrella or raincoat, as sudden rain showers are common. Wearing light cotton clothes will help in dealing with humidity.
For 32-year-old Arun K, coming really close to qualifying in the Civil Services Examination, the most rigorous professional test in the country, was of little consolation.
Having exhausted all his chances and a better part of his youth in trying to qualify, he was left with the same predicament faced by a majority of those who appear for this exam: belatedly starting professional life from scratch. Despite being overqualified, he took up the only job that he managed to land after a desperate search — as an entry-level administrative assistant in a public school on the outskirts of Delhi.
Until he got a phone call from a Delhi-based corporate, which was fully updated about how he had fared in the Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) examination and evaluated him for his very pretty solid record in the penultimate stages of that exam, while taking into consideration his Masters degree, to eventually employ him at a mid-seniority grade and a salary that was multiples of what he was getting at the local school. The job position at the new employer was more in sync with his academic qualifications, and duly acknowledged his performance in what is regarded as the toughest qualifying examination in India.
And for this, he has to thank an initiative of the UPSC called the Public Disclosure Scheme (PDS), through which the Commission has started sharing details of the non-recommended, willing candidates of the Commission’s examinations with the private sector since early this year. Non-recommended candidates are essentially those who qualify in the written examinations but are not recommended post interview.
The logic for this is simple. The UPSC conducts 10 regular examinations every year and recommends some 6,400 successful candidates for appointments in various services; but approximately 26,000 candidates, who have already demonstrated their proficiency by clearing the rigorous written examinations, are declared not successful at the end of the process.
Arun was one among the 26,000, who did not qualify the interview, but ended up in the above 97 percentile in his examination category, and over-qualified for an entry-level job, but also overaged as compared to peers, and lacking in any work experience.

title: IMD issues orange alert in THESE districts for very heavy rainfall; Delhi to see light rain, thunderstorms on 17 July - MSN
article_text:
IMD Weather Updates: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued an orange alert, warning of heavy rainfalls in several states including Kerala, Karnataka, Uttar Pradesh and Uttarakhand among other states.
The IMD has issued an Orange Alert for heavy rainfall in several districts across states. Check them out:
In Jammu and Kashmir – Muzaffarbad, Kupwara, Poonch, Rajouri, Jammu, Mirpur, Samba, Kathua, Udhampur, Doda, Kishtwar, Ramban, Reasi
In Karnataka – Chikmagalur, Hassan, Kodagu
In Uttarakhand – Dehradun, Rudraprayag, Chamoli, Nainital
In Uttar Pradesh – Mahoba, Kaushambi, Banda, Sonbhadra, Prayagrag, Fatehpur, Jalaun, Lalitpur
In Madhya Pradesh – Jhansi, Chitrakoot
Mindy Rasmussen, a 47-year-old Illinois woman, traveled to Pakistan to meet her 31-year-old boyfriend, Sajid Zeb Khan, whom she met online and fell in love with. The US woman has gone viral for her Chicago to Upper Dir lover story that has the support of both families.
Mindy met Sajid online through Facebook a year ago and reached Pakistan earlier this month on a 90-day visit visa. Pakistani media reported that Rasmussen converted to Islam and adopted new name Zulekha as she solemnized her marriage with Sajid. Sajid said there was no force on Mindy to travel to Pakistan and to convert to Islam -- neither from him nor from his family. “She is a mature woman capable of making her own choices. We are tying the knot of our own free will," Sajid told the Dawn.
Mindy said she informed her family members including her father, older sister and younger brother, that she was going to Pakistan to marry the man she met online. They all supported the decision and were excited. The US woman said it was her first visit to Pakistan and she was welcomed with flowers at Islabamad International Airport by Sajid. Then they traveled to Dir where she received a warm welcome from his family members and neighbors.
“It’s my first visit to Pakistan, and I must say it’s a beautiful and peaceful country,” she said, as quoted by Pakistani media. “The kindness and hospitality I’ve experienced here are beyond anything I expected.” Mindy also said to Pakistani media she would encourage other foreigners to visit Pakistan and explore its culture, hospitality and beauty.
Mindy said her husband Sajid is a loving and humble man whose sincerity and respect drew her closer to him. Mindy said she would go back to the US and get paperworks for Sajid's immigration done and Sajid too would later move to the US.

title: How flash floods are redrawing the map of Northeast India - Daily Pioneer
article_text:
Each monsoon season, Northeast India braces for its old friend: the Brahmaputra. But what arrives now is something more haunting — a deluge that drowns towns before dawn, turns mountain roads into graveyards of mud, and forces people out of their homes without warning.

In late May and early June, cities like Guwahati saw an unprecedented 111 mm of rain in 24 hours — breaking a 67-year record and overwhelming urban drains, according to the India Meteorological Department. Reports from Arunachal, Assam, Meghalaya, Mizoram, and Tripura confirmed that sudden flash floods and landslides killed at least 34 people and displaced thousands. In Assam alone, ‘ThePrint’ reported that over 6.8 lakh people were affected… and nearly 50 lives lost.

From urban streets turned into swift-moving rivers to hillside homes collapsing into valleys, the season’s brutality was both emotional and existential — an accelerating crisis rooted in climate extremes and infrastructure failure.

Experts confirm that warming air is transforming predictable rains into short, savage downpours. The Himalayan slopes and floodplains of the Northeast, already fragile, bear the brunt. According to IMD data, Sikkim saw multiple landslides under intense monsoon bursts, while Assam and Arunachal faced mudslides and waterlogged terrain. At the same time, increased glacial melt in Tibet and the eastern Himalayas contributes to swelling rivers. Sand mining, unplanned roadworks, and urban encroachments only magnify the destruction.

A tea plantation worker in upper Assam recounted waking up to find her ceiling collapsing under water pressure. She barely rescued her infant. Relief shelters, she said, were overcrowded, lacking food, hygiene, and dignity.

According to official data from Golaghat district authorities, 8,373 people across 57 villages were displaced, with 19 relief camps activated. In Silchar, the government acknowledged the loss of traditional wetlands, prompting the Chief Minister to call for their revival.

Floodwaters breached multiple embankments. The Assam State Disaster Management Authority reported that 78,000 residents across 15 districts were affected as 10 major rivers crossed danger levels. Meanwhile, schools in Guwahati were closed and electricity cut off to prevent electrocution.

Nagaland wasn’t spared either. The overflowing Dhansiri river submerged farmland and displaced thousands — local reports confirmed the devastation.

Despite the frequency of these events, India’s approach remains more reactive than preventive. Compensation is delayed. Urban planning continues to build over wetlands and natural flood plains. Early-warning systems exist but fail to reach many at-risk communities. Insurance for flood damage remains negligible.

What’s urgently needed is a shift to climate-smart planning. This includes restoring wetlands like Silchar’s Malini Beel, enforcing geo-sensitive building codes, and implementing digital warning systems that actually reach the last mile. Livelihood restoration programmes and pre-season disaster funds must become standard practice.

This isn’t just a regional problem. Similar flash floods have begun affecting regions like coastal Karnataka, Bengal, and Bhutan. Northeast India is simply the canary in the coal mine.

Yet amidst the wreckage, communities offer hope. In Dhemaji, local volunteers are teaching school children to row rescue boats.

Women’s self-help groups are forming emergency aid collectives. These acts of grassroots resilience provide a model that’s deeply local — and remarkably effective. We must stop treating floods as seasonal inconveniences. They are early warnings from a destabilising climate. Northeast India doesn’t just need rescue — it needs reform, readiness, and most importantly reimagination. We can no longer afford to treat these floods as unfortunate natural events — they are manifestations of systemic neglect and a climate reality that is already here. The science has long warned us, and the losses measured in lives, land, and livelihoods have become annual testaments to what delayed action costs.

Northeast India is not just on the frontlines; it is a stress test for India’s climate governance. How we respond here will set the tone for how the nation prepares for a future where unpredictability is the only constant.

(The author is journalist from Northeast India. She is also a Red Ink Awardee and IVLP nominee)

title: Uttarakhand weather update: Yellow alert in Pithoragarh, Bageshwar for heavy downpour; 61 roads blocked by debris - News9live
article_text:
Dehradun: Uttarakhand remains under weather distress as the India Meteorological Department (IMD) issued a yellow alert for heavy to very heavy rainfall in Pithoragarh and Bageshwar districts.
Thunderstorms, lightning, and gusty winds up to 40 km/h are also expected in several other districts, including Tehri, Haridwar, Almora, and Udham Singh Nagar.
The state has been witnessing intermittent showers since early morning, with Dehradun recording significant rainfall before 10 AM on Thursday. While the morning rain brought relief from the heat, the post-rain humidity left residents uncomfortable. The city’s maximum temperature was recorded at 29.0°C and the minimum at 23.2°C. Pantnagar saw a high of 33.4°C, while Mukteshwar and New Tehri remained cooler at 20.7°C and 19.4°C respectively.
The IMD has forecast continued rainfall across Uttarakhand for the next few days, with isolated intense spells likely in the hill districts. The changing weather pattern—sunshine alternating with cloud cover and rain—has disrupted daily life and travel.
One of the most serious impacts has been on road connectivity. According to the State Emergency Operations Center, 61 roads across the state are currently blocked due to landslides and debris. These include the Hubertpur–Vikasnagar–Lakhwar National Highway 16 in Dehradun district, which remains closed for heavy vehicles. Eleven rural roads in Dehradun are also inaccessible.
Other affected districts include: Uttarkashi: 7 roads closed, Tehri: 5 roads closed, Rudraprayag: 7 roads closed,Pithoragarh: 9 roads closed, Pauri Garhwal: 7 roads closed, Nainital: 3 roads closed, Chamoli: 8 roads closed, Bageshwar: 2 roads closed, Almora: 1 road closed. Efforts are underway to clear debris and restore traffic, but officials warn that continued rainfall may delay operations. The Public Works Department and disaster response teams are working in coordination to reopen blocked routes, especially those critical for Char Dham pilgrims and local commuters.
In Mussoorie, landslides have already disrupted traffic on the Dhanaulti road earlier this week, and similar risks persist in other mountainous regions. Authorities have advised residents and tourists to avoid travel in landslide-prone areas and to stay updated on weather and road conditions.
Click for more latest India news. Also get top headlines and latest news from India and around the world at News9.
Namita is an Assistant News Editor at News9 Live. She has reported on a range of issues from Uttarakhand for mainstream papers such as The Hindu and websites such as Firstpost.com. She has also covered elections in the hill state for both Deccan Herald and The Hindu. Her passion is dissecting the politics of Uttarakhand and meeting and understanding the principal political actors of the state. Namita did PG Diploma in Journalism from AMU and later she pursued MJMC, when not busy writing, she loves to spend time with books, poetry and fiction as well as nonfiction.

UP Weather Update: उत्तर प्रदेश में मानसून का प्रबल प्रभाव देखा जा रहा है। जहां एक ओर जुलाई महीने में भारी वर्षा हो रही तो वहीं दूसरी ओर तापमान में भी भारी गिरावट दर्ज की जा रही है, जिससे आमजन में राहत है।
Priya Singh Bisen
Published on: 18 July 2025 6:00 AM (Updated on: 18 July 2025 6:01 AM)

UP Weather Update

Follow us on

UP Weather Update: उत्तर प्रदेश में मानसून का प्रबल प्रभाव देखा जा रहा है। जहां एक ओर जुलाई महीने में भारी वर्षा हो रही तो वहीं दूसरी ओर तापमान में भी भारी गिरावट दर्ज की जा रही है, जिससे आमजन में राहत है। आज 18 जुलाई यानी शुक्रवार को राजधानी लखनऊ का मौसम सुहावना बना रहेगा।

सुबह कुछ देर के लिए धुप निकलेगी लेकिन वातावरण ठंडा रहेगा। मौसम विभाग के मुताबिक, तापमान दिन के समय लगभग 35 °C के आसपास रहेगा और रात में तापमान न्यूनतम 26 °C रहेगा। सुबह थोड़ी-बहुत वर्षा की संभावना बनी हुई हैं, लेकिन धूप भी समय-समय पर दिखेगी। चलिए जानते हैं विस्तार से कि आज का मौसम कैसा रहने वाला है।

सुबह के समय में मौसम का हाल ?

वर्षा की संभावना: दिन की शुरुआत में हल्की वर्षा से हो सकती है। मौसम विभाग की रिपोर्ट के मुताबिक, सुबह वर्षा हो सकती है, लेकिन लगातार नहीं होगी।

हवा व नमी: मॉनसून की फुहारों के कारण आर्द्रता (ह्यूमिडिटी) में वृद्धि रहेगी। इससे सुबह की हवा में थोड़ी ठंडक अनुभव होगी, लेकिन नमी के कारण वातावरण कुछ भारी बना रहेगा।

दोपहर के समय मौसम का हाल ?

धूप एवं बादल: वर्षा के कम होने के बाद दिन में बादल स्थापित रहेंगे, लेकिन बीच-बीच में तेज धूप हो सकती है जिससे तापमान ज्यादा रहने की संभावना है।

तापमान: अधिकतम तापमान करीब 35 °C तक रह सकता है, जो मौसम को गर्म बनाए रखेगा। हालांकि बादलों की आड़ से धूप सीधे चेहरे पर नहीं पड़ेगी, तथापि उमस महसूस होगी।

रात का मौसम ?

तापमान में कमी: रात में अधिकतम गिरावट की संभावना नहीं है। न्यूनतम तापमान लगभग **26 °C* रहेगा, जो गर्म बना रहेगा।

राहत भरी हवा: शाम से हवा थोड़ी ठंडी और हलकी चलेगी। मॉनसून के कारण रात में ठंडक महसूस हो सकती है।

स्वास्थ्य और गतिविधियों के लिए सुझाव

1. नियमित हाइड्रेशन: मौसम को ध्यान में रखते हुए दिन में कई बार पानी, फलों का रस या कोई इलेक्ट्रोलाइट ड्रिंक पियें, ताकि शरीर की नमी बनी रहे। गर्मी और उमस के कारण निर्जलीकरण की संभावना बनी रहती है।

2. हल्का स्थान-निर्धारण: सुबह या शाम का कोई भी बाहरी काम करना हो, तो सिर ढक कर रखें और हल्के कपड़े पहनें। दुपहर के वक़्त तेज धूप में बाहर निकलने से बचें।

3. वर्षा की तैयारी: आज हल्की वर्षा के आसार को देखते हुए, अपने साथ में छाता या रेनकोट रखें, ख़ासकर सुबह के समय।

4. स्वास्थ्य की देखभाल: उमस और गर्मी के कारण त्वचा, सिर में दर्द या पेट से जुड़ी परेशानियाँ हो सकती हैं। ऐसे लक्षणों पर नजर रखें और ज़रूरत पड़ने पर डॉक्टर की राय अवश्य लें।

लखनऊ की स्थानीय जीवनशैली पर प्रभाव

इस मौसम में लोग सुबह‑शाम की ताजी हवा का आनंद लेने किले के आसपास या पार्कों में जा सकते हैं। हल्की वर्षा के कारण मौसम सुहावना बना रहेगा, जिससे कुछ लोगों की सुबह की सैर‑फिटनेस की दिनचर्या पर असर पड़ेगा – हो सकता है उसे समय बदलना पड़े।

बता दे, आज 18 जुलाई का मौसम राहत भरा रहने वाला है। सुबह हल्की वर्षा, फिर बादल और बीच-बीच में धूप के साथ तापमान 35 °C - 26 °C के आसपास बना रह सकता है। मौसम विभाग द्वारा दी गई जानकारी के मुताबिक, आमजन को मौसम की तैयारी पहले से ही कर लेनी चाहिए। हल्की वर्षा और उमसपूर्ण गर्मी के बीच सूचनापूर्ण दिनचर्या से आप किसी भी परिस्थिति में सहज रहेंगे।

title: यूपी के 26 जिलों में बहुत भारी बारिश की चेतावनी: प्रयागराज के तूफान में 200 नावें टूटी; चित्रकूट में मंदाकि... - Dainik Bhaskar
article_text:
यूपी में मानसून बारिश का दौर जारी है। नदी-नाले उफान पर हैं। इससे कई जिलों में हालात बिगड़ गए हैं। 24 घंटे में बारिश से 7 लोगों की मौत हो गई। चित्तौड़गढ़ में मंदाकिनी नदी खतरे के निशान से 2 मीटर ऊपर बह रही है।

.

प्रयागराज में गंगा-यमुना नदी उफान पर हैं, तूफान से 200 नावें टूट गईं। कुछ नदी में भी डूब गईं। 15 से ज्यादा मोहल्लों की 5 लाख की आबादी पानी से घिर गई है। वाराणसी में सभी 84 घाट नदी में जलमग्न हो चुके हैं। घाट किनारे के 1 हजार मंदिर भी डूब चुके हैं। गंगा खतरे के निशान से सिर्फ 1.56 मीटर दूर है।

चित्रकूट में लगातार बारिश से तुलसी वाटरफॉल में सैलाब आ गया है। शिवरामपुर में बाढ़ में दो मासूम बच्चे बह गए। आज पूरे प्रदेश में बारिश की संभावना है। मौसम विभाग ने आज 26 जिलों में बहुत भारी बारिश और 49 जिलों में भारी बारिश का अलर्ट जारी किया है। 40-50 KM प्रति घंटे की रफ्तार से हवा चलेंगी। बिजली गिरने की चेतावनी जारी की गई।

तस्वीरें देखिए---

सोनभद्र के कनहर बांध का जलस्तर 256 मीटर तक पहुंच गया। बांध के 8 गेट खोल दिए गए हैं।

प्रयागराज की ड्रोन फुटेज। गंगा-यमुना में बाढ़ से 5 लाख की आबादी पानी से घिर गई। प्रशासन अलर्ट है।

यूपी में कल 70 जिलों में 14.5 मिमी बारिश गुरुवार की बात की जाए तो सबसे ज्यादा 240 मिमी बारिश मिर्जापुर के चुनार में हुई। इसके अलावा, प्रयागराज में 209 मिमी, जौनपुर में 142 मिमी, सोनभद्र में 100 मिमी और वाराणसी में 92.2 मिमी बारिश रिकॉर्ड की गई।

पूरे प्रदेश की बात करें तो 70 जिलों में 14.5 मिमी बारिश रिकॉर्ड की गई। यह सामान्य 9.5 मिमी से 53% ज्यादा है। वहीं, 1 जून से 16 जुलाई तक यूपी में कुल 252.5 मिमी बारिश हुई, जो नॉर्मल 238.9 मिमी से 6% अधिक है। यानी, प्रदेश में मानसूनी बारिश अच्छी हो रही है।

यूपी में मानसूनी सीजन में किस शहर के क्या हाल, पल-पल की अपडेट के लिए नीचे ब्लॉग से गुजर जाइए...

title: UP Weather: यूपी के इन जिलों में अगले 24 घंटों में भारी बारिश की चेतावनी, वज्रपात का भी अलर्ट - ABP News
article_text:
उत्तर प्रदेश में बारिश का सिलसिला जारी है. गुरुवार को प्रदेश के कई जिलों में झमाझम बारिश हुई, जिसकी वजह से जगह-जगह पर जलभराव की स्थिति बनी हुई है और लोगों के आने जाने में परेशानी का सामना करना पड़ रहा है. नदियों का जलस्तर भी बढ़ गया है. बरसात का ये सिलसिला आज (18 जुलाई) भी जारी रहेगा. मौसम विभाग ने अगले 24 घंटों में बहुत भारी बारिश होने का ऑरेंज अलर्ट जारी किया हैं. बारिश के साथ तेज झोंकेंदार हवाएं चलने की चेतावनी दी है.
मौसम विभाग के मुताबिक पश्चिमी यूपी के ज़्यादातर हिस्सों में आज गरज-चमक के साथ अनेक स्थानों पर बारिश होगी, पूर्वी यूपी के भी कुछ जिलों में अच्छी बारिश के आसार है. ललितपुर, झांसी और महोबा में लगभग सभी स्थानों पर बहुत भारी बारिश होने का ऑरेंज अलर्ट है. इन जिलों कहीं-कहीं मेघ गर्जन के साथ वज्रपात और 40-50 किमी की रफ्तार से तेज झोंकेदार हवाएं चलने का अलर्ट है. कहीं-कहीं बहुत भारी बारिश होने की संभावना है.
बारिश से तापमान में आई गिरावट
शनिवार को मानसून की रफ्तार में कमी आएगी. इस दिन पूरे राज्य में मौसम सामान्य रहेगा. लेकिन 20 जुलाई से एक बार फिर से प्रदेश में भारी बारिश का दौर शुरू हो जाएगा. 23 जुलाई तक प्रदेश के अलग-अलग हिस्सों में बारिश होती रहेगी. अगले 24 घंटों में अधिकतम तापमान में 2-4 डिग्री तक की अचानक गिरावट आएगी. इसके बाद फिर से बढ़ोतरी होने की संभावना है.
यूपी में आज आगरा, जालौन, हमीरपुर, बांदा, चित्रकूट, औरैया, कानपुर, इटावा, फिरोजाबाद, और मथुरा में कई जगहों पर तेज बारिश, मेघ गर्जन और बिजली गिरने की चेतावनी दी गई है. कन्नौज, मैनपुरी, फर्रुखाबाद, एटा, कासगंज. हाथरस, अलीगढ़, बुलंदशहर और नोएडा में भी आज अनेक स्थानों पर बारिश होने का अनुमान है.
सहारनपुर, शामली, मुजफ्फरनगर, मेरठ, बागपत, ग़ाज़ियाबाद, हापुड़, अमरोहा, बिजनौर, मुरादाबाद, रामपुर, बरेली, बदायूं, शाहजहांपुर, हरदोई, उन्नाव, रायबरेली, कौशांबी, प्रयागराज, मीरजापुर, सोनभद्र में आज कुछ स्थानों पर बारिश होगी. इन जिलों में वज्रपात का भी यलो अलर्ट जारी किया गया है.
पीलीभीत, लखीमपुर खीरी, सीतापुर, लखनऊ, बहराइच, श्रावस्ती, अमेठी, प्रतापगढ़, जौनपुर, वाराणसी, चंदौली, बलरामपुर, सिद्धार्थनगर, कुशीनगर और महाराज में आज एक या दो जगहों पर हल्की बारिश की बौछारें हो सकती हैं. इन जिलों में किसी तरह का अलर्ट नहीं है. बाकी जिलों में मौसम के शुष्क रहने का अनुमान है.
